title: BMaaS — 02 Infrastructure & Hardware Health
description: Power/energy per entity, cooling/thermal, NVMe storage, memory/CPU, network I/O, system health.

panels.title: GPU Power per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: GPU power draw per DGX node. B200 = 8 × 1000W = 8kW max.

METRIC: gpu_power_usage — per-entity aggregate GPU power.
SIGNIFICANCE: Sustained at TDP = healthy. Below during load = throttling.

panels.title: CPU Power per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: CPU handles job orchestration, data loading, I/O.

METRIC: cpu_power_usage — per-entity CPU power.
NOTE: Typically 300-500W for dual-socket Grace CPUs.

panels.title: Combined Power (GPU+CPU) per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: Total power envelope per node — capacity planning + billing.

FORMULA: gpu_power_usage + cpu_power_usage per entity.
DGX B200 typical: ~10-12kW. Unexpected spikes = PSU issue.

panels.title: GPU Enforced Power Limit
panels.description:
WHY: If enforced limit < max TDP, admin or DCGM is power-capping the GPU.

METRIC: GPU_enforced_power_limit — currently active power cap per GPU.
SIGNIFICANCE: Changes during workload = dynamic power management.

panels.title: GPU Power Management Limit
panels.description:
WHY: Configured maximum power limit — set by admin.

METRIC: gpu_power_management_limit.
NOTE: If enforced < management limit, system is actively throttling.

panels.title: Per-GPU Power Draw (All 8)
panels.description:
WHY: Identify which specific GPU is consuming more/less power.

METRICS: gpu0_power .. gpu7_power.
SIGNIFICANCE: Large variance across GPUs on same node = issue.

panels.title: GPU Die Temperature (All 8)
panels.description:
WHY: Primary thermal indicator — liquid-cooled B200 should stay < 83°C.

METRICS: gpu0_temperature .. gpu7_temperature.
ACTION: > 83°C = throttling starts. > 90°C = CDU cooling issue.

panels.title: Thermal Aggregates (GPU + CPU)
panels.description:
WHY: Fleet-wide aggregated temperature for quick anomaly detection.

METRICS: total_gpu_temperature (avg across all GPUs on a node) + total_cpu_temperature (avg across CPUs on a node).
SIGNIFICANCE: If multiple nodes show elevated temps simultaneously, it indicates a facility-level cooling issue (CRAC/CRAH failure, CDU problem).
ACTION: Compare with per-GPU temps to confirm.

panels.title: GPU Shutdown Temperature
panels.description:
WHY: Emergency thermal shutdown threshold — last line of defense.

METRIC: GPU_shutdown_temperature.
NOTE: If die temp approaches this, GPU will hard-shutdown to prevent damage.

panels.title: Alert Level per Entity
panels.description:
WHY: BCM alert level per node — identifies which nodes have active alerts.

METRIC: alert_level — BCM's internal severity scoring.
MEANING: This is a cumulative integer — higher = more/worse alerts.
For example, 145 could mean multiple warning+critical alerts summed.
ACTION: Sort by highest value to find most problematic nodes. Check BCM console for specific alert messages.

panels.title: Disk Free Space
panels.description:
WHY: OS/scratch disk — if full, jobs fail to write checkpoints.

METRIC: free_space — available filesystem space.
ACTION: < 10% free = urgent cleanup needed.

panels.title: Disk Usage
panels.description:
WHY: Track disk consumption trends.

METRIC: diskspace — used filesystem space.

panels.title: NVMe Drive Critical Status
panels.description:
WHY: NVMe SSDs have limited write endurance and can fail.

METRICS: nvme*_critical — 0 = healthy, > 0 = drive failing.
nvme*_spare — remaining spare capacity (100 = full, 0 = exhausted).
ACTION: Critical > 0 or Spare < 10 = REPLACE DRIVE.

panels.title: NVMe PCIe Errors
panels.description:
WHY: NVMe drives connect via PCIe — errors = bus instability.

METRICS: nvme*_pci_errors — PCIe error counters.
SIGNIFICANCE: Rising = drive or slot degrading. May need reseat.

panels.title: FPGA UP
panels.description:
WHY: FPGA accelerators for specialized workloads.

METRIC: fpga_as_up.

panels.title: FPGA DOWN
panels.description:
WHY: FPGA failure detection.

METRIC: fpga_as_down.

panels.title: Network Connectivity
panels.description:
WHY: BCM composite network connectivity check.

METRIC: network_connectivity — 1 = connected, 0 = isolated.

panels.title: Overall Health Score
panels.description:
WHY: BCM composite health score per node.

METRIC: overall_health — BCM-calculated health value.
SIGNIFICANCE: Track trends — declining = hardware degradation.

panels.title: Memory Utilization (%)
panels.description:
WHY: System RAM for DGX host processes, CUDA memory management.

METRIC: memory_utilization — percentage of RAM used.
ACTION: > 90% = risk of OOM kills. Check for memory leaks.

panels.title: Memory Used vs Free
panels.description:
WHY: Absolute memory values for capacity planning.

METRICS: total_memory_used + total_memory_free.

panels.title: CPU Utilization (%)
panels.description:
WHY: CPU handles job scheduling, data loading, I/O — critical for throughput.

METRIC: total_cpu_utilization.
NOTE: High CPU with low GPU util = CPU bottleneck.

panels.title: Hardware Corrupted Memory
panels.description:
WHY: Physical RAM failure — uncorrectable DRAM bit error.

METRIC: hardware_corrupted_memory — pages of corrupted memory.
ACTION: > 0 = REPLACE DIMM. System memory is unreliable.

panels.title: Bytes Recv / Sent
panels.description:
WHY: System-level network throughput for data ingestion and results.

METRICS: bytes_recv + bytes_sent.

panels.title: Frame Errors & Drops
panels.description:
WHY: NIC-level errors indicate hardware or driver issues.

METRICS: frame_errors + error_sent + drop_recv.
ACTION: Rising errors = check NIC firmware, cable, switch port.

panels.title: NFS Server Activity
panels.description:
WHY: Shared storage I/O — NFS for datasets, checkpoints, logs.

METRICS: nfs_server_packets_tcp + nfs_server_packets_udp.
SIGNIFICANCE: High drops or latency = storage bottleneck.

panels.title: Swap Usage
panels.description:
WHY: Swap activity = severe memory pressure. Bad for GPU workloads.

METRICS: swap_used + swap_total.
ACTION: swap_used > 0 during GPU job = investigate OOM.

panels.title: System Load (1m)
panels.description:
WHY: Load average vs core count — oversubscription indicator.

METRIC: load_one — 1-minute load average.
RULE: load > cores_total = oversubscribed.

panels.title: Threads Used
panels.description:
WHY: Active thread count — helps detect runaway processes.

METRIC: threads_used — total active threads.
SIGNIFICANCE: Unusually high = potential process leak.
